subject: Investing
title: What Are Dividends?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Are Dividends?.

hook.text: Imagine owning a bakery and taking home a share of the profits every quarterâ€”without baking a single loaf.

buildup.text: A dividend is a portion of a company's profits distributed regularly to shareholders.

discovery.text: Companies pay dividends to reward investors and signal financial health and stable cash flows.

twist.text: Not all companies pay dividends. High-growth firms like early Amazon reinvested every dollar instead.

climax.text: Dividend-paying companies tend to be more mature and stable, making them anchors in many portfolios.

punchline.text: Dividends are your share of the profits. You earn while you sleep.

quiz.question: What is a dividend?
options: A share of company profits paid to shareholders
